snippet.title: Broncos launch Plan B title bid
snippet.content: WAYNE Bennett will road test his Plan B blueprint for premiership success when Ben Hunt and Kodi Nikorima train together for the first time on Wednesday in the absence of injured hooker Andrew McCullough. The Broncos are coming to terms with the season-ending loss of McCullough and a new chapter begins this week when Hunt and Nikorima form a hooker-halfback alliance for Saturday night's derby against the Gold Coast Titans. Bennett has handed McCullough's No. 9 jumper to Hunt, while Nikorima is back at halfback and has the chance to atone after being hooked against the Raiders five weeks ago. Hulking winger Corey Oates has been named 18th man and will push for selection this week. The former Maroons winger has been sidelined for the past month with a staph infection and hasn't given up hope of returning against the Titans at Robina.
